problems.title: Power Function using Divide and Conquer
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Implement pow(x, n) - calculate x raised to the power n using Divide and Conquer.
Use the property: x^n = x^(n/2) * x^(n/2) if n is even, x * x^(n-1) if n is odd.
This gives O(log n) time complexity instead of O(n).

Handle negative powers: x^(-n) = 1 / x^n
problems.constraints:
-100.0 < x < 100.0
-30 <= n <= 30
Result will fit in a double

hintsList: Base case: n=0 returns 1. If n<0, compute pow(x, -n) and return 1/result.
Recursive: half = pow(x, n/2). If n is even, return half*half. If odd, return x*half*half.
